dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Host_B, can we just talk about what a wild week it's been with China? I mean, Vice President Pence really, um, threw a cannonball, didn't he?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Host B, can we just talk about what a wild week it's been with China? I mean, Vice President Pence really, um, threw a cannonball, didn't he?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vice President Mike Pence launched a cannonball across the bow of Chinas ship of state last week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. Saying China's meddling in our midterm elections, like, because they want President Trump gone? That's a pretty big accusation to just drop out there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. Saying China's meddling in our midterm elections, like, because they want President Trump gone? That's a pretty big accusation to just drop out there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He said the country was meddling in the midterm elections. They want President Trump gone in an impeachment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And if that's true, it opens the door for Washington to hit them with sanctions under those new executive orders. It just feels like relations are, you know, not getting any better.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. And if that's true, it opens the door for Washington to hit them with sanctions under those new executive orders. It just feels like relations are, you know, not getting any better.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If China was meddling, it sets the table for Washington to sanction them under two new executive orders signed by Trump and the August 2017 Countering Americas Adversaries Through Sanctions Act. The politics between Beijing and Washington are not improving.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Not at all. I mean, Secretary of State Pompeo was just over there, and by all accounts, he was getting absolutely nowhere with his Chinese counterparts. They just have these fundamental disagreements.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not at all. I mean, Secretary of State Pompeo was just over there, and by all accounts, he was getting absolutely nowhere with his Chinese counterparts. They just have these fundamental disagreements.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Top diplomats on both sides said Secretary of State Mike Pompeo was getting nowhere with this Chinese counterparts. He said they were fundamental disagreements over a range of issues from trade to Chinas domestic and foreign policies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which, uh, we're seeing play out in the markets, right? Chinese equities, especially those A-shares, just got hammered last week after their holiday. Some Shanghai indexes were down almost five percent!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, uh, we're seeing play out in the markets, right? Chinese equities, especially those A shares, just got hammered last week after their holiday. Some Shanghai indexes were down almost five percent!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Following a weeklong holiday in China, mainland equities fell by as much as 4.7% in some Shanghai stock indexes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a pretty sorry state of affairs, especially for all those U.S. mutual funds that had to reallocate to mainland China. It's really been a losing bet for them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a pretty sorry state of affairs, especially for all those U S mutual funds that had to reallocate to mainland China. It's really been a losing bet for them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The China A-shares (ASHR) are down over 22% year-to-date, a sorry state of affairs for dozens of U.S. mutual funds benchmarked to the MSCI Emerging Markets Index and who have been mandated to reallocate a portion of portfolio funds to mainland China equities now that they are part of the MSCI EM. Its been a losing bet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And China's not taking it lying down either. Foreign Minister Wang Yi was, um, pretty vocal, accusing Washington of escalating the trade conflict.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And China's not taking it lying down either. Foreign Minister Wang Yi was, um, pretty vocal, accusing Washington of escalating the trade conflict.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi accused Washington of escalating the trade conflict, interfering with Taiwan, and leveling false accusations against China regarding election interference and inserting chips in Apple products in order to spy on U.S. companies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right! And also interfering with Taiwan, and then, like, making these "false accusations" about election interference and even, get this, putting spy chips in Apple products.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right! And also interfering with Taiwan, and then, like, making these false accusations about election interference and even, get this, putting spy chips in Apple products.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi accused Washington of escalating the trade conflict, interfering with Taiwan, and leveling false accusations against China regarding election interference and inserting chips in Apple products in order to spy on U.S. companies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Wow. And then we had that whole, uh, scheduled visit from China's vice premier, Liu He, that just got canceled for "some reason."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. And then we had that whole, uh, scheduled visit from China's vice premier, Liu He, that just got canceled for some reason.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Chinas vice premier Liu He was supposed to come to Washington on Monday, but that was canceled for some reason.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it just shows you. They're not just not on the same page, they're not even in the same book, politically and economically. It's a mess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it just shows you. They're not just not on the same page, they're not even in the same book, politically and economically. It's a mess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They are not only not on the same page on trade matters, but they are also not even in the same book.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And it seems China is now officially viewing Trump's policies as, like, "economic warfare," which is a pretty strong term.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it seems China is now officially viewing Trump's policies as, like, economic warfare, which is a pretty strong term.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It has finally come to pass that China views Trumps policies against it as economic warfare.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It is! They even released this massive 36,000-word paper outlining their official view, accusing Washington of trying to achieve economic hegemony.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is! They even released this massive thirty six thousand word paper outlining their official view, accusing Washington of trying to achieve economic hegemony.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Beijing recently released a 36,000-word paper on representing the official view on U.S. trade frictions, published on Xinhua News Agency on Monday. They accused Washington of seeking economic hegemony and intimidating other countries through economic measures including tariffs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, what are *they* doing on their side to counter all this? I heard something about tax cuts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what are they doing on their side to counter all this? I heard something about tax cuts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh. Some tax cuts, but economists are saying their policymakers are still mostly reactive, not proactive, with stimulus. Though, they *did* promise to inject like $110 billion into the economy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh huh. Some tax cuts, but economists are saying their policymakers are still mostly reactive, not proactive, with stimulus. Though, they did promise to inject like one hundred ten billion dollars into the economy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Macquarie Capital economists Larry Hu and Irene Wu wrote in a recent note that Chinese policymakers remain reactive, not proactive in conducting stimulus and add that Beijings policy loosening is still way behind the curve. Someone must have been listening to them at the central bank. They promised to inject $110 billion into the economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Which, uh, Russia seems to be their only outspoken ally right now, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, uh, Russia seems to be their only outspoken ally right now, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For now, China's most outspoken ally is Russia, a country weakened by U.S. and European sanctions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. And even international business groups, like the B20, are blasting China over their state-owned enterprises. China, of course, pushed back hard on that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. And even international business groups, like the B twenty, are blasting China over their state owned enterprises. China, of course, pushed back hard on that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Business 20, an international business advisory group affiliated with the Group of 20, blasted Beijing over the role of state-owned enterprises in the world economy. ... The China group demanded revisions to the sections covering state-owned enterprises and their role in global markets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They certainly did. They don't want that brought up at the G20. So, yeah, no improvement in sight.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They certainly did. They don't want that brought up at the G twenty. So, yeah, no improvement in sight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They insisted that the B20 proposal should not be submitted to G20 leaders at the Argentina meetup in November.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Not a bit. It's just a really tense situation all around.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not a bit. It's just a really tense situation all around.
